intro: Galium anisophyllon subsp. anisophyllon, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its opposite, linear to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinct, slightly serrated edge. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its slender stems and delicate foliage make it a distinctive member of the Galium genus.
